src:
Olahan Bebek Maknyus
Ini Ciri Khas Bebek Madura, yang Beda Dengan Bebek Surabaya
02 Nov 2019, 03:00 by Sonia Basoni - detikFood


Foto: dok. detikFood

Jakarta - Serupa tapi tak sama, hidangan bebek populer di Madura dan Surabaya. Ternyata banyak perbedaan dari dua kuliner bebek populer ini.Hampir setiap daerah punya resep dan ciri khas dari olahan bebek. Mulai dari disulap menjadi gulai, mie, hingga jadi bebek ungkep semuanya memiliki cita rasa yang berbeda. Begitu juga bebek goreng gaya Madura serta Surabaya.Baca Juga: Jajan Nikmat di 5 Warung Nasi Bebek Madura yang Populer


Foto: dok. detikFood

Lokasi Madura dan Surabaya yang tak terlalu jauh, membuat hidangan bebek goreng di sana punya gaya yang mirip. Meski begitu tetap ada perbedaan dari dua bebek goreng ini."Bebek Madura sama Bebek Surabaya, jelas beda. Perbedaan yang paling mencolok adalah, di bumbu bebek ini. Kalau bebek Madura biasanya disajikan dengan bumbu hitam ini," jelas Siti Aisah kepada detikFood (30/10), selaku pemilik Rumah Makan Nasi Bebek Pak Munawi Khas Madura, yang ada di Ampera, Jakarta Selatan.


Foto: dok. detikFood

"Sementara kalau bebek goreng Surabaya itu, mereka lebih banyak menyandingkannya dengan masakan khas Jawa Timur, seperti dipenyet, dicobek, dan sebagainya," tutur Siti yang asli dari Bangkalan, Madura, dan sudah berjualan nasi bebek lebih dari 8 tahun di Jakarta.Di Nasi Bebek Pak Munawi ini, racikan bumbu hitamnya yang jadi andalan dan membuat para pelanggan setianya selalu ketagihan."Bumbu hitam ini, menggunakan bahan-bahan dan bumbu umum, tak ada yang spesial. Bahan utamanya ada cabe merah, bawang, lalu diaduk selama dua jam sampai warnanya hitam dan mengental seperti ini. Mengaduknya tak boleh berhenti, karena kalau berhenti, di bawahnya bisa gosong. Jadi buat bumbu hitam nasi bebek khas Madura ini, harus butuh kesabaran," ungkap Siti.


Ibu Siti Aisah, Pemilik Nasi Bebek Pak Munawi. Foto: dok. detikFood

Untuk jenis bebek yang digunakan, kebanyakan bebek khas Madura ini menggunakan bebek cokelat atau bebek kampung. Karena rasanya yang dinilai lebih gurih, dibandingkan jenis bebek lainnya."Bebeknya kita pakai bebek cokelat yang ada di pasar. Dulu pernah ditawarkan bebek peking, cuma saya tidak mau, karena ukurannya terlalu besar, dan rasanya mirip seperti ayam. Pelanggan saya justru tidak mau dikasih bebek peking, maunya bebek cokelat saja, daging muda atau tua, semuanya sama saja," lanjutnya.Sementara untuk perbedaan rasa, biasanya bebek Madura ini punya bumbu yang lebih pedas dibandingkan bebek Surabaya. Namun, semuanya tergantung kembali ke selera, dan setiap penjual nasi bebek punya racikan masing-masing.


Foto: dok. detikFood

"Kalau di tempat lain, hanya nasi bebek saja. Kalau di sini ada pelengkapnya juga, yaitu ati bebek, nanti disiram dengan bumbu hitam ini, rasanya pedas dan gurih,"Untuk satu porsi nasi bebek di Pak Munawi harganya dibanderol Rp 30.000 saja. Sementara untuk ati bebek, dihargai Rp 11.000 per potongnya."Sehari kita bisa laku 200 potong bebek, dan kalau ramai bisa dua kali lipat," pungkas Siti, yang berencana akan membuka gerai kedua di sekitar Jakarta Selatan.Baca Juga: Uenaak Poll! 5 Nasi Bebek di Surabaya Legendaris dan EnakSimak Video "Rahasia Nikmatnya Nasi Bebek Cak Malik Jakarta Pusat"[Gambas:Video 20detik](sob/odi)
text:
Processed Duck Maknyus
This is a Characteristic of Madura Duck, which is Different from Surabaya Duck
02 Nov 2019, 03:00 by Sonia Basoni - detikFood


Photo: dock. detikFood

Jakarta - Similar but not the same, duck dishes are popular in Madura and Surabaya. It turns out that there are many differences from these two popular duck culinary. Almost every region has recipes and special characteristics of processed ducks. Starting from being transformed into curry, noodles, until it became a duck duck all have different tastes. Likewise, Madura style fried duck and Surabaya. Also Read: Delicious Snacks at 5 Popular Madura Duck Rice Stalls


Photo: dock. detikFood

The location of Madura and Surabaya is not too far away, making fried duck dishes there have a similar style. Even so there are still differences from these two fried ducks. "Madura Duck and Surabaya Duck, clearly different. The most striking difference is, in this duck seasoning. Madura duck is usually served with this black spice," explained Siti Aisah to detikFood (30 / 10), as the owner of the Pak Munawi Khas Madura Rice Restaurant, which is in Ampera, South Jakarta.


Photo: dock. detikFood

"Meanwhile, if the Surabaya fried duck, they are more juxtaposed with typical East Java dishes, such as smoked, torn, and so on," said Siti who is originally from Bangkalan, Madura, and has been selling duck rice for more than 8 years in Jakarta. This Pak Munawi duck, concoction of black spices that become a mainstay and make loyal customers always addicted. "This black spice, using ingredients and general seasonings, nothing special. The main ingredients are red chili, onion, then stir for two hours until the color is black and thickens like this. Stirring should not stop, because if it stops, the bottom can be charred. So for Madura's typical black duck rice seasoning, you need patience, "said Siti.


Mrs. Siti Aisah, Owner of Pak Munawi Duck Rice. Photo: dock. detikFood

For the type of duck used, most of the typical Madura ducks use brown or village ducks. Because the taste is considered more savory, compared to other types of ducks. "We use brown duck on the market. It used to be offered Peking duck, but I didn't want to, because the size is too big, and it tastes like chicken. My customers just don't want it. given Peking duck, just want brown duck, young or old meat, everything is the same, "he continued. While for the difference in taste, usually this Madura duck has a spicy seasoning compared to Surabaya duck. However, everything depends back to taste, and every duck rice seller has their own concoctions.


Photo: dock. detikFood

"If in other places, only duck rice. If there is also a supplement here, namely duck liver, later doused with black herbs, it tastes spicy and savory," For one serving of duck rice in Munawi the price is priced at Rp 30,000. As for duck liver, valued at Rp 11,000 per piece. "One day we can sell 200 pieces of duck, and if it's busy it can be doubled," concluded Siti, who plans to open a second outlet around South Jakarta. Also Read: Uenaak Poll! 5 Legendary Duck Rice in Surabaya and EnakSimak Video "The Secret to the Enjoyment of Cak Malik Duck Rice in Central Jakarta" [Gambas: Video 20seconds] (sob / odi)
